image.altText: Close-up of electronic gaming machine screen.

props.synopsis: Previously secret documents released under Freedom of Information laws have revealed how the Northern Territory's pokies clubs' community contributions are really being spent.

title.children: Secret documents reveal NT clubs' pokies profits staying in-house

image.altText: A woman being sworn into the NT parliament.

props.synopsis: Loraine Braham, a pioneering figure in Northern Territory politics and the first woman to serve as Speaker of the Legislative Assembly, has passed away aged 87 in Alice Springs.

title.children: Trailblazing NT politician Loraine Braham has died, aged 87

image.altText: A woman with dark hair and earrings looks at the camera with a neutral expression

props.synopsis: Angie Fuller has been missing for three years. Police are offering an equal record reward for information into what they believe is a suspected outback murder.

title.children: A vast expanse, a missing woman, and doubt she's even out there at all

image.altText: Park rangers standing alongside a long crocodile, with duct tape secured around the animal's jaw.

props.synopsis: Rangers in the Northern Territory have caught an average of a crocodile per day in the first week of 2026, including one measuring 4.9 metres pulled from waters near a popular swimming spot.

title.children: NT rings in new year with a crocodile captured each day so far

image.altText: An outback landscape with a sign that reads Barrow Creek.

props.synopsis: The Barrow Creek Hotel was thrust into the global spotlight during the investigation into British backpacker Peter Falconio's disappearance. Now its liquor licence has been suspended for breaching Northern Territory licensing laws.

title.children: Remote pub at centre of Peter Falconio mystery has liquor licence suspended

image.altText: Carriages from a derailed freight train.

props.synopsis: The derailment of a freight train on a key section of railway in South Australia is affecting all transcontinental train services as heatwave conditions in the area impact the pace of recovery works.

title.children: A derailed freight train has shut a key railway line. Here's what we know

image.altText: A man, face unseen, wears a camouflage uniform with the US Customs and Border Protection insignia on the sleeve.

props.synopsis: US Border Patrol agents were conducting a vehicle stop in Portland, Oregon, when the driver "weaponised" the vehicle before an officer "fired a defensive shot", according to the Department of Homeland Security.

title.children: US federal agents shoot two people in Portland, police say

image.altText: A young woman with glasses wearing a black top smiling.

props.synopsis: When a Telegram message landed on her phone, Diana knew she had to flee Venezuela. It was from someone close to Nicolás Maduro, and she says she would have been jailed, or worse.

title.children: Diana received a tip to flee Venezuela. She was on a list to be arrested

image.altText: A crowd pulses through the city

props.synopsis: Australia's population is forecast to reach 28 million people in 2026 despite an easing of overseas arrivals following the post-COVID-19 migration peak.

title.children: Australia's population forecast to reach 28 million this year

image.altText: Protesters gather in front of the US consulate during a demonstration in Nuuk

props.synopsis: The United States has a long history of wanting to acquire Greenland, but people living on the island say Donald Trump's latest comments about annexation feel different.

title.children: In Greenland, Trump's talk of annexation is stirring up a dark past

image.altText: Iranians gather while blocking a street during a protest

props.synopsis: Human rights groups say more than 40 people have been killed in protest-related violence since last month.

title.children: Trump warns Iran will 'pay hell' if protesters are killed amid internet outage

image.altText: Andrew Rawle in a hat, blue shrt and beige shorts smiles while standing on red dust, with powerlines in the background.

props.synopsis: Pilbara resident Andrew Rawle found himself 30,000 feet in the air, unable to breathe due to anaphylactic shock, but was saved by the crew and the selfless act of another passenger.

title.children: Routine flight to WA mining town leaves man facing life-or-death scenario

image.altText: Nicolas Maduro in tan clothing ducking his head while surrounded by three DEA officers, next to a black helicopter

props.synopsis: The deposed Venezuelan president allegedly oversaw a network of associates to facilitate the flow of illegal drugs into the US, aided by false passports, a guerilla training school, jets and grenade launchers.

title.children: Inside Maduro's network of alleged drug traffickers wanted by the US

image.altText: A tall middle-aged man in a dark suit and red tie looks at the camera

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank says inflation is "too high", but that doesn't mean it will necessarily rush to raise interest rates next month.

title.children: 'How rude can I be?' RBA deputy gets candid on inflation and rates

image.altText: Two Rio Tinto hard hats look out at West Angelas site

props.synopsis: Rio Tinto and Glencore are in takeover talks that could potentially lead to a combined mega miner worth more than $US200 billion. Analysts are questioning whether Rio will be interested in Glencore's coal assets, having sold off its own in 2018.

title.children: Rio Tinto in merger talks with Glencore but total takeover not the only option

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Glencore has confirmed media speculation that the company is back in merger talks with Rio Tinto. Follow updates live on our business and finance blog.

title.children: Rio Tinto stock tumbles on mega merger talks, dragging down ASX  — as it happened

image.altText: A TV still of Noah Wyle, 54, stethoscope in his ears, crowding, with Supriya Ganesh, 28, and more, over a person on a gurney.

props.synopsis: ER launched Noah Wyle's career in 1994. Thirty years later he's back in the emergency room — and scooping awards season — as Dr Robby in The Pitt.

title.children: With five Emmys and two Golden Globes noms, everyone's loving The Pitt

image.altText: Kyra Cooney-Cross looks on while wearing an Arsenal hoodie before a game.

props.synopsis: Arsenal's Australia international Kyra Cooney-Cross flies back to Australia to be with her mother, who has been diagnosed with stage 4 cancer.

title.children: 'Our world changed': Matildas star returns home to face family tragedy

image.altText: Nick Kyrgios walking out of the Brisbane International arena waving to the crowd after his loss

props.synopsis: Returning from injury, Nick Kyrgios has spoken with Australian Open organisers and made the call not to use a wildcard to play singles this year.

title.children: Kyrgios says he will not be seeking an Aus Open wildcard

image.altText: A lady holding an aircon remote control and pointing it towards the unit system on the wall

props.synopsis: With the nation gripped by a heatwave, renters will be looking at their rights for cooling their homes. Here's what they can do.

title.children: What landlords are obliged to do to cool your rental property

image.altText: Travis Head of Australia looks on with Steve Smith

props.synopsis: The internet went wild as Australia dominated with the bat, led by Travis Head and Steve Smith, and England crumbled in the dying embers of the Ashes.

title.children: How the internet reacted to Australia's victory in the fifth Ashes Test

image.altText: Teagan Croft with long hair, blonde highlights wearing a suit jacket

props.synopsis: Australian actress Teagan Croft will take on the lead role of Rapunzel in Disney's Tangled. The 21-year-old will star alongside Milo Manheim in the live-action remake.

title.children: Teagan Croft will play Rapunzel in Disney's Tangled. Here's what we know

image.altText: Chris Minns in a suit at Bondi

props.synopsis: Community groups that lobbied for a national inquiry into antisemitism back the prime minister's announcement of a royal commission as the NSW premier pledges the NSW government's full cooperation.

title.children: 'Vitally important' royal commission examines Bondi attack, Minns says

image.altText: A man wearing goggles holding a camera and a woman with a ukelele and an akubra.

props.synopsis: From tablets, headphones and laptops, to prams, vacuum cleaners and even a prosthetic leg — these are the items being left behind each year at major airports.

title.children: 'Airport brain': The weird things Aussie travellers leave behind every year

image.altText: Silhouette of transmission lines at dusk with sun flaring through

props.synopsis: For so long, the pounding sunshine of an Australian heatwave was the grid's biggest threat. It has now become its greatest asset.

title.children: From scourge to saviour: How the sun powered the grid through a heatwave

image.altText: Princess Catherine in profile with a dark hat and brown checked blazer and light on her face

props.synopsis: Catherine turns 44 today as she resets royal life with fewer public appearances, tighter boundaries and a strong emphasis on family life — a choice shaped by loss, illness and the pressure of being next in line.

title.children: As she turns 44, Princess Catherine is quietly reshaping royal life

image.altText: An aerial view of a large piece of land near the coast

props.synopsis: More than 30 years after the land was rezoned to allow residential development, blocks in the Kings Forest Estate are finally on the market.

title.children: Coastal land rezoned in the 1980s finally hits the housing market

image.altText: A man carrying documents outside a court

props.synopsis: South Australian MP Nick McBride, who has been charged with aggravated assault, says home detention will make him "more focused" on his electorate ahead of the SA election in March.

title.children: MP accused of assault says home detention makes him 'more wedded' to electorate

image.altText: A young girl with her horse.

props.synopsis: Angela Jones became the number one jockey in Queensland in 2025. Now, the determined young woman, who grew up on a central Queensland cattle farm, wants Group 1 glory.

title.children: How a horse-mad girl from the outback became queen of racing in Queensland

image.altText: A man in a grey suit and wearing glasses stands next to a police officer in uniform.

props.synopsis: A brazen heist at Port Vila International Airport has stunned Vanuatu and become the talk of a nation unused to such overtly public acts of crime.

title.children: 'Like a movie': The brazen airport heist that stunned a Pacific nation

image.altText: A vintage teel and white car

props.synopsis: Australia’s biggest car festival roars to life amid a scorching heatwave, thrill-seeking crowds and strict policing.

title.children: Australia's largest car festival revs into action amid soaring temperatures

image.altText: Two Tasmania Police officers stand next to a patrol car.

props.synopsis: Two men face court after a 66-year-old man died from injuries police allege were sustained in an assault at a popular Hobart shopping strip.

title.children: Men charged with manslaughter over alleged Hobart CBD assault face court

image.altText: A man with brown hair taking a selfi

props.synopsis: Isaac James Martin, 31, says he has not "bothered" to get legal representation, telling a Brisbane court he "killed old mate because he's a child molester".

title.children: 'I killed old mate': Prisoner confesses to killing 'child molester' inmate

image.altText: A triptych of three images from female social media influencers with text graphics overlaid

props.synopsis: Americans are posting sunny social media dispatches about their new lives in Australia, but there is something more revealing underneath.

title.children: How the 'American in Australia' trend reveals something about us and them
